itemDescription: Scottish archaeologist, numismatist, curator and professor

wikipedia_page.main: Anne Strachan Robertson FSA FSAScot FRSE FMA FRNS (3 May 1910 – 4 October 1997) was a Scottish archaeologist, numismatist and writer, who was Professor of Roman Archaeology at the University of Glasgow and Keeper of the Cultural Collections and of the Hunterian Coin Cabinet at the Hunterian Museum. She was recognised by her research regarding Roman Imperial coins and as "a living link with the pioneers of archaeological research".

response: * May 3 – Anne Strachan Robertson, Scottish archaeologist and numismatist (d. 1997).
* October 4 - Anne Strachan Robertson - Scottish archaeologist and numismatist (b. 1910)
*Anne Strachan Robertson (1910–1997), Scottish archaeologist, numismatist and writer
*Anne Strachan Robertson (1910–1997), Scottish archaeologist, numismatist and writer

Papers were presented by Andreas Alföldi, Jean Baradez, Antonio Frova, Albert Egges van Giffen, Ulrich Kahrstedt, Rudolf Laur-Belart, V E Nash-Williams, Hans Norling-Christensen, Franz Oelmann, Anne Strachan Robertson and Mortimer Wheeler.

Macdonald was a significant influence on Anne Strachan Robertson, one of his students; her obituary states that "Her own rich contribution owed much to the influence of Sir George Macdonald, who dominated Romano-British studies between the world wars. From him she imbibed the patience in noting details and the dispassionate weighing of evidence that Macdonald had so admired in Francis Haverfield, an earlier giant in the field".
*Anne Strachan Robertson, 87, Scottish archaeologist, numismatist and writer.
